source_sentence: 佛說太子瑞應本起經卷上
translation: Foshuo taizi ruiying benqi jing shoushang lun

source_sentence: 吳月支優婆塞支謙譯
translation: Wu Yuezhi Upāsaka Zhiqian Translation

source_sentence: 佛言：「吾自念宿命，無數劫時，本為凡夫。
translation: The Buddha said, "I've been mindful of my past lives for countless eons, when I was originally a worldling.

source_sentence: 初求佛道已來，精神受形，周遍五道。
translation: Since I first sought the Buddha Way, my spirit has been endowed with form and has traveled throughout the five destinies.

source_sentence: 一身死壞，復受一身，生死無量。
translation: After one body dies and disintegrates, I'll be subject to another body, and birth-and-death will be countless.

source_sentence: 譬喻盡天下草木，斬以為籌，計吾故身，不能數矣。
translation: It's like chopping up all the grass and trees in the world and using them as sticks to count my old body, which cannot be counted.

source_sentence: 「夫極天地之始終，謂之一劫，而我更天地成壞者，不可稱載也。
translation: "The ultimate whole of heaven and earth is called an eon, and I can't even begin to tell you how much more I've formed and destroyed heaven and earth.

source_sentence: 所以感傷世間貪意長流，沒於愛欲之海，吾獨欲反其源故，自勉而特出。
translation: That's why I'm sad that the world's long stream of greed is lost in the ocean of craving, and I alone want to go against its source and make a special effort to escape.

source_sentence: 是以世世勤苦，不以為勞；虛心樂靜，無為無欲；損己布施，至誠守戒，謙卑忍辱，勇猛精進，一心思微學聖智慧。
translation: That's why I work hard from generation to generation, not taking it as labor; I open my mind, enjoy quiescence, do nothing, and have no desire; I undermine my own generosity, observe the precepts with utmost sincerity, humble myself, tolerate humiliation, make vigorous effort, and single-mindedly contemplate the subtleties of training in noble wisdom.

source_sentence: 仁活天下，悲窮傷厄，慰沃憂慼，育養眾生，救濟苦人，承事諸佛，別覺真人，功勳累積，不可得記。
translation: He humanely enlivens the world, pities the poor and hurting, comforts the weary, nurtures sentient beings, rescues the suffering, serves the buddhas, and identifies real people, accumulating untold merit.

source_sentence: 至于昔者，定光佛興世，有聖王名曰制勝治，在鉢摩大國，民多壽樂，天下太平。
translation: In the past, when the Buddha of Constant Light was born, there was a noble king named Siddhârtha who was in the great country of Pāma, where the people lived long and happily and the world was at peace.

source_sentence: 時我為菩薩，名曰儒童；幼懷聰叡，志大包弘，隱居山澤，守玄行禪。
translation: At the time, I was a bodhisattva named Rudō; I was young and wise, had a great deal of ambition, lived in a hermitage in a mountain swamp, and observed profound meditation.

source_sentence: 聞世有佛，心獨喜歡，披鹿皮衣，行欲入國。
translation: Hearing that there were buddhas in the world, my heart was alone in liking them, so I put on a deerskin robe and traveled to the country with the intention of entering it.

source_sentence: 道經丘聚，聚中道士，有五百人。
translation: There were 500 Taoists in the group of mounds that had passed through the Way.

source_sentence: 菩薩過之，終日竟夜，論道說義，師徒皆悅。
translation: The bodhisattva passed by them, spent his days and nights discussing the Way and teaching its meaning, and his teachers and disciples were delighted.

source_sentence: 臨當別時，五百人各送銀錢一枚，菩薩受之。
translation: When it was time to part, each of the five hundred men gave him a coin of silver, which the bodhisattva accepted.

source_sentence: 「入城見民，欣然怱怱，平治道路，灑掃燒香。
translation: "When he entered the city and met the people, he hurried happily, leveled the roads, and burned incense.

source_sentence: 即問行者：『用何等故？』
translation: He then asked the practitioner, 'What's the purpose?'

source_sentence: 行人答曰：『今日佛當來入城。』
translation: The monk replied, 'Today the Buddha will come and enter the city.'

source_sentence: 菩薩大喜，自念：『甚快！
translation: The bodhisattva was overjoyed and thought to himself, 'Very soon!'

source_sentence: 今得見佛，當求我願。』
translation: Now that I've seen the Buddha, I will ask for my vow.'

source_sentence: 「語頃，王家女過，厥名瞿夷，挾水瓶持七枚青蓮華。
translation: "While he was speaking, a woman named Ghoṣa from the king's household passed by, carrying a water bottle and holding seven blue lotus flowers.

source_sentence: 菩薩追而呼曰：『大姊且止！
translation: The bodhisattva chased after her and called out, 'Stop, big sister!

source_sentence: 請以百銀錢雇手中華。』
translation: Please hire a flower in your hand for a hundred pieces of silver.'

source_sentence: 女曰：『佛將入城，王齋戒沐浴，華欲上之，不可得也。』
translation: The woman said, 'The Buddha will enter the city, and the king will observe precepts and bathe, but the flower is wanted, but it's unobtainable.'

source_sentence: 「又請曰：『姊可更取求。』
translation: "She also asked, 'Can you ask for more?'

source_sentence: 雇二百三百不肯，即探囊中五百銀錢，盡用與之。
translation: She refused to hire 2,300, so she took 500 coins from her pocket and gave them all to him.

source_sentence: 瞿夷念華，極直數錢，乃雇五百，貪其銀寶，與五莖華，自留二枚。
translation: Remembering the flower, Ghoṣa was very straightforward about counting the money, so he hired 500 of them, coveted their silver and jewelry, and gave them five stalks of flower, keeping two for himself.

source_sentence: 迴別意疑：『此何道士，披鹿皮衣，裁蔽形體，不惜銀錢寶，得五莖華？』
translation: He wondered in a different way, 'What kind of Taoist man wears a deerskin robe and covers his body, sparing no silver, money, or treasure to obtain five stalks of flowers?'

source_sentence: 憘怡非恒，追呼：『男子！
translation: Doña Ekaviṃśati called after him, 'Men!

source_sentence: 以誠告我，此華可得；不者奪卿。』
translation: Tell me honestly that you can have this flower; if you don't, I'll take it from you.'

source_sentence: 菩薩顧曰：『買華從百錢至五百，以自交決，何宜相奪？』
translation: The bodhisattva looked after him and said, 'Why should you take the flower from a hundred coins to five hundred, when you can decide for yourself?'

source_sentence: 女曰：『我王家人，力能奪卿。』
translation: The woman said, 'I'm from the king's family, and I have the power to take you.'

source_sentence: 菩薩慝然曰：『欲以上佛，求所願耳。』
translation: The bodhisattva thoughtfully replied, 'I want to go up to the Buddha and seek what I wish.'

source_sentence: 「瞿夷曰：『善！
translation: "Gopī said, 'Good!

source_sentence: 願我後生，常為君妻，好醜不相離；必置心中，令佛知之。
translation: May I always be your wife in my afterlife, so that my good and ugly are not separated from each other; I will surely keep this in my heart so that the Buddha will know it.

source_sentence: 今我女弱，不能得前，請寄二華，以獻於佛。』
translation: Now, since my daughter is too weak to go before him, I'd like to send you two flowers to offer to the Buddha.'

source_sentence: 菩薩許焉。
translation: The bodhisattva agreed.

source_sentence: 「須臾佛到，國王臣民，皆迎拜謁，各散名華，華悉墮地。
translation: "In a moment's time, when the Buddha arrived, the king and his subjects greeted him and worshipped him, scattering flowers of various names that all fell to the ground.

source_sentence: 菩薩得見佛，散五莖華，皆止空中，當佛上如根生，無墮地者。
translation: When the bodhisattva got a glimpse of the Buddha, he scattered five flowers, all of which stopped in the air while the Buddha was up there like a root growing, and none of them fell to the ground.

source_sentence: 後散二華，又挾住佛兩肩上。
translation: Later, he scattered two flowers and held them to the Buddha's shoulders.

source_sentence: 佛知至意，讚菩薩言：『汝無數劫，所學清淨，降心棄命，捨欲守空，不起不滅，無猗之慈，積德行願，今得之矣。』
translation: Knowing what he really wanted, the Buddha praised the bodhisattva, saying, 'You've trained in purity for countless eons, subdued your mind and abandoned your life, abandoned desire and kept to emptiness, neither risen nor ceased, accumulated virtue and vowed, and now you've attained it.'

source_sentence: 因記之曰：『汝自是後，九十一劫，劫號為賢，汝當作佛，名釋迦文(天竺語，釋迦為能，文為儒，義名能儒)。』
translation: He therefore recorded it, saying, 'After this, for 91 eons, your eon name will be Goodness, and you will become a buddha named Śākyamuni (in the Indian language, Śākyamuni means able, and Śākyamuni means Confucian, which means able to teach).'

source_sentence: 「菩薩已得記言，疑解望止；霍然無想，寂而入定。
translation: "After the bodhisattva receives the assurance, he hopes to stop doubts and resolve them; he suddenly becomes without thoughts and enters concentration with calmness.

source_sentence: 便逮清淨不起法忍，即時輕舉，身昇虛空，去地七仞，從上來下，稽首佛足。
translation: He then acquires the pure tolerance of nonarising, immediately lifts himself up into the sky, goes seven feet below the ground, and presents himself at the Buddha's feet from above and below.

source_sentence: 見地濯濕，即解皮衣，欲以覆之，不足掩泥，乃解髮布地，令佛蹈而過。
translation: Seeing that the ground was soaked, he took off his leather robe and tried to cover it up, but it wasn't enough to cover the mud, so he untied his hair and spread it on the ground, allowing the Buddha to step through it.

source_sentence: 佛又稱曰：『汝精進勇猛，後得佛時，當於五濁之世，度諸天人，不以為難，必如我也。』
translation: The Buddha also praised him, saying, 'You must exert yourself and be bold; when you later become a buddha, you will save gods and humans in the five turbid realms; you won't think it's difficult; you'll be like me.'

source_sentence: 「菩薩承事定光，至于泥曰。
translation: "The bodhisattva then obeyed Dīpaṃkara and went to the brim saying.

source_sentence: 奉戒護法，壽終即生第一天上，為四天王。
translation: 'I will observe precepts and protect the Dharma, and when my life span ends, I'll be born on the first heaven as one of the four heavenly kings.

source_sentence: 畢天之壽，下生人間，作轉輪聖王飛行皇帝——七寶自至，一、金輪寶，二、神珠寶，三、紺馬寶朱髦鬣，四、白象寶朱髦尾，五、玉女寶，六、賢鑒寶，七、聖導寶——八萬四千歲，壽終即上生第二忉利天上，為天帝釋。
translation: After finishing his life, he descends to the human realm and becomes a wheel-turning sage king and flying emperor-with seven treasures of his own, namely, a golden-wheel treasure, a sacred-jewel treasure, a vermilion-hued hyena, a violet-horse treasure, a vermilion-hued hyena, a white elephant treasure, a violet-hued tail, a jade-niece treasure, a good-looks treasure, and a holy-directing treasure-elapsing 84,000 years of age, he'll be born in the second heaven of the Thirty-three Celestials as Indra.

source_sentence: 壽盡又昇第七梵天，為梵天王。
translation: When his life span is up, he ascends to the seventh Brahma Heaven and becomes the king of the Brahma Heaven.

source_sentence: 如是上作天帝，下為聖主，各三十六反，周而復始。
translation: Thus, he becomes the emperor of heaven and the lord of the sages below, each with thirty-six counterpoints, going from week to week.

source_sentence: 及其變化，隨時而現，或為聖帝，或作儒林之宗，國師道士，在所現化，不可稱記。
translation: They change and appear at any time, sometimes as noble emperors, sometimes as Confucian scholars, national masters, and Daoists, and there are indescribable manifestations of them.

source_sentence: 「菩薩於九十一劫，修道德，學佛意，通十地行，在一生補處。
translation: "During the 91 eons, the bodhisattva cultivates morality, trains in the Buddha's mind, and penetrates the ten stages of practice, remaining in the complementary position for one lifetime.

source_sentence: 後生第四兜術天上，為諸天師，功成志就，神智無量。
translation: He was then born in the fourth Tuṣita Heaven and became one of the gods' teachers, accomplishing his aim and having measureless spiritual wisdom.

source_sentence: 期運之至，當下作佛，託生天竺迦維羅衛國，父王名白淨，聰叡仁賢；夫人曰妙，節義溫良。
translation: When his fortune was fulfilled, he was then born as a buddha in the Indian kingdom of Kapilavastu, where his father's name was Bai Jing, a wise and kind man, and his wife's name was Miao, a gentle and virtuous man.

source_sentence: 迦維羅衛者，三千日月萬二千天地之中央也。
translation: "Kapilavastu is the center of 3,000 suns, 2,000 moons, and 10,000 heavens and earth.

source_sentence: 佛之威神，至尊至重，不可生邊地，地為傾邪，故處其中。
translation: The Buddha's dignified and most important spirit can't be born in a marginal place; the earth is tilted toward evil, so he's placed there.

source_sentence: 周化十方，往古諸佛興，皆出於此。
translation: It's where all the buddhas of yore who have arisen in the ten directions of the world have come from.

source_sentence: 「菩薩初下，化乘白象，冠日之精。
translation: "When the bodhisattva first descended, he was transformed into a white elephant that crowns the sun's essence.

source_sentence: 因母晝寢，而示夢焉，從右脇入。
translation: As his mother slept during the day, he showed her a dream and entered through her right hypochondrium.

source_sentence: 夫人夢寤，自知身重，王即召問太卜，占其所夢。
translation: When the lady awoke from her dream, she knew she was heavy, so the king summoned the diviner to divine her dream.

source_sentence: 卦曰：『道德所歸，世蒙其福，必懷聖子。』
translation: The trigram said, 'To whom morality belongs, the world will be blessed and he will surely bear a noble son.'

source_sentence: 菩薩在胎，清淨無有臭穢。
translation: When a bodhisattva is in the womb, he's pure and without a stench.

source_sentence: 於是群臣諸小國王，聞大王夫人有娠，皆來朝賀。
translation: Then a group of ministers from lesser kingdoms heard that the great king's wife was pregnant and all came to congratulate him.

source_sentence: 菩薩於胎中，見外人拜，如蒙羅縠而視，陰以手攘之。
translation: While in the womb, the bodhisattva sees outsiders worshipping him as if he were covered with a silk gauze and looks at them, and he polishes them with his hand.

source_sentence: 攘之者意，不欲擾人也。
translation: He shook it away because he didn't want to disturb people.

source_sentence: 自夫人懷姙，天為獻飲食，自然日至，夫人得而享之，不知所從來，不復饗王厨，以為苦且辛。
translation: Since the lady was pregnant, the gods offered her food and drink, which came naturally, and the lady was able to enjoy it without knowing where it came from, and she didn't serve it to the king's kitchen again because it was painful and painful.

source_sentence: 到四月八日夜明星出時，化從右脇生墮地，即行七步，舉右手住而言：『天上天下，唯我為尊。
translation: When the stars rose on the eighth day of the fourth month, she was born from her right hypochondrium and fell to the ground. She took seven steps, held up her right hand, and said, 'I'm the only one in heaven and on earth who's honored.

source_sentence: 三界皆苦，何可樂者？』
translation: The three realms are all painful; how could there be pleasure?'

source_sentence: 「是時天地大動，宮中盡明。
translation: "At the time, heaven and earth were greatly disturbed, and the palace was completely illuminated.

source_sentence: 梵釋神天，皆下於空中侍。
translation: The Brahmā and Śakra gods and goddesses all descended into the sky to attend on him.

source_sentence: 四天王接置金机上，以天香湯，浴太子身。
translation: The four heavenly kings placed him on a golden potion and bathed the prince's body in divine fragrant bath.

source_sentence: 身黃金色，有三十二相，光明徹照，上至二十八天，下至十八地獄，極佛境界莫不大明。
translation: His body was yellow-golden, with thirty-two marks and a radiant glow that shone brightly and thoroughly, reaching up to the twenty-eight heavens and down to the eighteen hells, where the very realm of the Buddha was not greatly illuminated.

source_sentence: 當此日夜，天降瑞應，有三十二種：一者、地為大動坵墟皆平，二者、道巷自淨臭處更香，三者、國界枯樹皆生華葉，四者、苑園自然生奇甘果，五者、陸地生蓮華大如車輪，六者、地中伏藏悉自發出，七者、中藏寶物開現精明，八者、篋笥衣被披在椸架，九者、眾川萬流停住澄清，十者、風霽雲除空中清明，十一、天為四面細雨澤香，十二、明月神珠懸於殿堂，十三、宮中火燭為不復用，十四、日月星辰皆住不行，十五、沸星下現侍太子生，十六、釋梵寶蓋彌覆宮上，十七、八方之神捧寶來獻，十八、天百味食自然在前，十九、寶甕萬口懸盛甘露，二十、天神牽七寶交露車至，二十一、五百白象子自然羅住殿前，二十二、五百白師子子從雪山出羅住城門，二十三、天諸婇女現妓女肩上，二十四、諸龍王女繞宮而住，二十五、天萬玉女把孔雀尾拂現宮牆上，二十六、天諸婇女持金瓶盛香汁列住空中侍，二十七、天樂皆下同時俱作，二十八、地獄皆休毒痛不行，二十九、毒虫隱伏吉鳥翔鳴，三十、漁獵怨惡一時慈心，三十一、境內孕婦產者悉男，聾盲瘖瘂癃殘百疾皆悉除愈，三十二、樹神人現低首禮侍。
translation: 當此日夜，天降瑞應，有三十二種：一者、地為大動坵墟皆平，二者、道巷自淨臭處更香，三者、國界枯樹皆生華葉，四者、苑園自然生奇甘果，五者、陸地生蓮華大如車輪，六者、地中伏藏悉自發出，七者、中藏寶物開現精明，八者、篋笥衣被披在椸架，九者、眾川萬流停住澄清，十者、風霽雲除空中清明，十一、天為四面細雨澤香，十二、明月神珠懸於殿堂，十三、宮中火燭為不復用，十四、日月星辰皆住不行，十五、沸星下現侍太子生，十六、釋梵寶蓋彌覆宮上，十七、八方之神捧寶來獻，十八、天百味食自然在前，十九、寶甕萬口懸盛甘露，二十、天神牽七寶交露車至，二十一、五百白象子自然羅住殿前，二十二、五百白師子子從雪山出羅住城門，二十三、天諸婇女現妓女肩上，二十四、諸龍王女繞宮而住，二十五、天萬玉女把孔雀尾拂現宮牆上，二十六、天諸婇女持金瓶盛香汁列住空中侍，二十七、天樂皆下同時俱作，二十八、地獄皆休毒痛不行，二十九、毒虫隱伏吉鳥翔鳴，三十、漁獵怨惡一時慈心，三十一、境內孕婦產者悉男，聾盲瘖瘂癃殘百疾皆悉除愈，三十二、樹神人現低首禮侍。

source_sentence: 當此之時，壃場左右，莫不雅奇，歎未曾有。
translation: At that time, everyone in the boundary area was amazed and admired the unprecedented presence of everyone around.

source_sentence: 「夫人即裹以白褻，乳母抱養，字名悉達。
translation: "The lady then wrapped herself in a white cloth, took her nurse into her arms, and called her name Siddhârtha.

source_sentence: 王告夫人：『子生非凡，吾國有道人，名曰阿夷，年百餘歲，耆舊多識，明曉相法；今欲共行相子可乎？』
translation: The king told her, 'The child is born extraordinary; there's a man of the Way in our country named Ajita who's more than a hundred years old, old and knowledgeable, and who knows the way of signs.

source_sentence: 夫人曰：『佳！』
translation: The lady said, 'Excellent!'

source_sentence: 即嚴駕白象，導從伎樂，出詣道人，賜黃金白銀各一囊，道人不受。
translation: He then drove a white elephant adorned with music and led them out to the Daoist and gave him a bag of gold and silver each, but the Daoist didn't accept it.

source_sentence: 披褻相太子，見有三十二相：軀體金色，頂有肉髻，其髮紺青，眉間白毫，項有日光，目睫紺色，上下俱瞬，口四十齒，齒白齊平，方頰車廣，長舌七合，滿師子膺，身平正，脩臂指長，足跟滿安平趾，手內外握，合縵掌手，足輪千輻理，陰馬藏，鹿腨腸，鈎鎖骨，毛右旋，一一孔一毛生，皮毛細軟，不受塵水，胸有万字。

source_sentence: 天王維睒，久知其意，即使鬼神，捧舉馬足，并接車匿，踰出宮城，到於王田閻浮樹下。
translation: The king of gods, Vaiśravaṇa, knew his intention for a long time, so he asked the demons to lift the horse's feet and carry Chasenajit as he passed out of the palace and went to the king's field under the jambu tree.

source_sentence: 明日宮中騷動，不知太子所在，千乘萬騎，絡繹而追。
translation: On the morrow, the palace was in an uproar, and they didn't know where the prince was, so they chased him with a thousand horses and ten thousand riders.

source_sentence: 王因自到田上，遙見太子，坐於樹下。
translation: The king then went up to the field himself and saw the prince sitting under a tree from a distance.

source_sentence: 日光赫烈，樹為曲枝，隨蔭其軀。
translation: The sun was shining brightly, and the tree had twisted its branches to shadow his body.

source_sentence: 王悚然悟驚，乃知其神，不識下馬，為作禮時，太子亦即前拜曰：『自我為子，希曾出國，今一適此，大王何宜抂來，願用時還。
translation: The king was startled and awakened, then he realized that he was a god, and when he didn't realize that he had dismounted from his horse and was about to pay homage, the prince also bowed before him, saying, 'Since I was a son, I've rarely traveled to this country, but now that I'm here, why is it advisable for the king to send this special gift?

source_sentence: 今我所以欲離世者，以自所見，恩愛如夢，室家歡娛，皆當別離。
translation: Now, I want to leave the world because I've seen myself in a situation where affection is like a dream, and my family is happy and entertained, but I must part with them.

source_sentence: 貪欲為獄，難得免出。
translation: Desire is a prison, and it's hard to escape from it.

source_sentence: 故曰：「以欲網自蔽，以愛蓋自覆，自縛於獄，如魚入笥口，為老死所伺，如犢求母乳。
translation: Therefore, he says, "Sheltered by the net of desire and covered by the lid of love, I'm bound to prison like a fish entering a container's mouth, and I'm being watched by old age and death like a calf seeking milk.

source_sentence: 吾恒以是，常自覺悟，願求自然，欲除眾苦。
translation: Because of this, I've always realized for myself that I want to pursue nature and want to remove all suffering.

source_sentence: 諸未度者，吾欲度之；諸未解者，吾欲解之；諸不安者，吾欲安之；未見道者，欲令得道。
translation: I want to save those who have yet to be saved, I want to understand those who have yet to be understood, I want to pacify those who are unsettled, and I want to make the path attainable for those who haven't yet seen it.

source_sentence: 故欲入山求我所願，得道當還，不忘此誓。」』
translation: Therefore, I want to enter the mountain and seek what I wish, and I will return when I attain the way, not forgetting this vow."

source_sentence: 「王知其志固，惘然不知所言。
translation: "The king knew his intentions were resolute, but he was at a loss for words.

source_sentence: 便自還宮，謂瞿夷曰：『如吾子心，清白難動如地，不樂富貴，不慕於天下，唯道是欲，自期必逮。』
translation: He then returned to the palace and told Ghoṣa, 'My son's mind is pure and difficult to move like the ground; he doesn't enjoy wealth and possessions, doesn't admire the world, and wants nothing but the path, and he expects to attain it.'

source_sentence: 「於是太子，攀樹枝見耕者，墾壤出虫，烏隨啄吞，感傷眾生，魚鱗相咀，其不仁者，為害滋甚，死墮惡道，求出良難。
translation: "The prince then climbed a tree branch and saw a plowman, plowed the soil and produced worms, which were pecked and swallowed by crows, injuring sentient beings and chewing on each other's scales.

source_sentence: 諸天雖樂，而亦非常，福盡則懼，罪至亦怖，禍福相承，生死彌久。
translation: Although the gods are happy, they're also very unlikely; they're afraid when their merits end, and they're afraid when their sins end; fortune and woe continue together, and birth and death last forever.

source_sentence: 觀見人間，上至二十八天，貴極而無道，皆與地獄對門。
translation: When we look at the human realm, we see that the highest 28 gods are noble and lack the path, and they all face the gates of hell.

source_sentence: 三惡道處，痛酷百端，歡樂暫有，憂畏延長。
translation: Where there are the three evil destinies, pain and suffering are numerous, joy and happiness are temporary, and sorrow and fear are prolonged.

source_sentence: 天地之間，無一可奇，吾不能復為欲惑矣。
translation: There's nothing in between heaven and earth that's surprising, and I can't be confused by desire anymore.

source_sentence: 「即起上馬，將車匿前行數十里，忽然見主五道大神，名曰賁識，最獨剛強，左執弓，右持箭，腰帶利劍，所居三道之衢：一曰天道，二曰人道，三曰三惡道，此所謂死者魂神，所當過見者也。
translation: "He then got up on his horse and drove his chariot a few dozen miles ahead, when he suddenly saw the lord, a great god of the five destinies named Benji, the most unique and powerful, holding a bow on his left, an arrow on his right, and a sharp sword at his waist, abiding in the thoroughfares of the three destinies: the first is the heavenly destiny, the second is the human destiny, and the third is the three evil destinies, which are called the souls and spirits of the dead, who should pass by and see them.

source_sentence: 太子到問：『何道所從？』
translation: When the prince arrived, he asked, 'What path is it that we're following?'

source_sentence: 賁識惶懅，投弓、釋箭、解劍，逡巡示以天道曰：『是道可從。』
translation: Ben's consciousness was terrified, so he threw out his bow, released his arrow, and untied his sword, and he looked around and showed them the way of heaven, saying, 'This is a path to follow.'

source_sentence: 「行數十里，逢兩獵客，太子自念：『我已棄家，在此山澤，不宜如凡人被服寶衣，有慾態也。』
translation: "After traveling a few dozen miles, he met two hunters. The prince thought to himself, 'I've abandoned my family and am here in the mountains and swamps; I shouldn't be dressed like an ordinary man in precious clothing; I'd have cravings.'

source_sentence: 乃脫身寶裘，與獵者貿鹿皮衣。
translation: So he took off his precious fur and traded it with the hunters for deerskin clothing.

source_sentence: 到前下馬，遣車匿還。
translation: When he arrived, he dismounted and sent Chandaka back.

source_sentence: 車匿長跪曰：『今隨大天，不可獨還。』
translation: Chandaka knelt down long enough and said, 'Now, I've followed the great gods, so I can't return alone.'

source_sentence: 太子曰：『汝可徑歸，上白大王，及謝舍妻，今求無為大道，勿以我為憂。』
translation: The prince said, 'You may go back in a straight path, tell the great king and thank his wife, and seek the great way of nothingness now; don't think of me as a worry.'

source_sentence: 即脫寶冠及著身衣，悉付車匿。
translation: He then took off his jeweled crown and body armor and handed them all to the chariot for safekeeping.

source_sentence: 於是白馬，屈膝舐足，淚如連珠。
translation: The white horse then bent his knees and licked his feet, weeping like a string of tears.

source_sentence: 車匿悲泣，隨路而啼。
translation: Lamenting, Chandaka wept and cried out along the road.

source_sentence: 顧視太子，已被鹿皮衣，變服去矣。
translation: He looked at the prince, saw that he had been covered with deerskin robes and had changed his clothes.

source_sentence: 「車匿步牽馬還，宮都中外，莫不惆悵。
translation: "When Chandaka returned with the horse in tow, everyone in the palace and outside the city was saddened.

source_sentence: 瞿夷啼哭，自投殿下曰：『我望太子，如渴欲飲，汝今與馬返獨空歸？』
translation: Ghoṣa wept and threw himself into the palace, saying, 'I was hoping for the prince, like a thirst for drink, but now you and the horse are going home alone and empty.'

source_sentence: 前抱馬頸，問太子所在。
translation: He went forward, hugged the horse by the scruff of its neck, and asked where the prince was.

source_sentence: 車匿曰：『太子上白大王及謝舍妻，今求無為大道，勿以我為憂。』
translation: Cana said, 'The prince told the king and Śākya's wife, 'Now, seek the great path of nothingness, and don't be concerned about me.'

source_sentence: 瞿夷啼哭曰：『一何薄命，生亡我所天。
translation: Ghoṣa wept, 'What kind of a miserable life is it that I was born and lost to the gods?

source_sentence: 為在何許？
translation: What is it?'

source_sentence: 當那求之？』
translation: Should I ask for it?'

source_sentence: 撫馬背曰：『太子乘汝出，汝何獨來歸？』
translation: He rubbed the back of a horse and said, 'The prince rode you out, but why did you come back alone?'

source_sentence: 舉國人民，莫不歔欷。
translation: The people of the country were all lamenting.

source_sentence: 王悲噢咿，涕泣交流，謂瞿夷曰：『如吾子所覺，老病死苦，實為大患。
translation: The king was overcome with sorrow and lamentation, and he wept and exchanged tears.

source_sentence: 此神人也，其生之日，上帝親下，万神侍衛，符瑞光相，非世所見。
translation: This is a godlike man who was born on a day when the god himself descended, was guarded by ten thousand gods, and had a talismanic appearance that was unlike anything seen in the world.

source_sentence: 阿夷相言：「若不樂天下，而棄家為道者，必為自然佛，當度脫萬姓。」
translation: Ajita said, "If he doesn't enjoy the world and abandons his family for the path, he will surely become a natural Buddha who will liberate all sentient beings."

source_sentence: 今辭學道，乃自然乎？』
translation: Now, if he resigns and trains on the path, will he be a natural one?"

source_sentence: 「王欲解瞿夷意，亦自感激，即選國中豪賢，得數千人，擇有累重多子孫者，取五人現之。
translation: "Desiring to understand Ghoṣa's intentions, the king also expressed his gratitude by selecting a few thousand of the country's best men and choosing five of them who had many children and grandchildren.

source_sentence: 王曰：『汝等於家長子抱孫，獨曰歡耶？
translation: The king said, 'Are you alone in saying that you're happy that your parents have children and grandchildren?'

source_sentence: 吾有一子未曾出門，一旦捨我，遠涉深山，溪谷險阻，吉凶之難，寒暑飢渴，誰得知者？
translation: I have a son who has never left home before. Once he leaves me, he'll wander far into the mountains, treacherous valleys and streams, and who will know about the difficulties of fortune and misfortune, cold and heat, hunger and thirst?

source_sentence: 煩卿五人，各遣一子，追求索之，得必隨侍。
translation: Please send five of your sons to pursue them, and they will surely accompany you.

source_sentence: 如有中道委而還者，吾滅汝族屬。』
translation: If you are entrusted with the middle path and return, I will annihilate your clan.'

source_sentence: 於是阿若拘隣等五人，受命追太子。
translation: So Ajñāta Kauṇḍinya and five others were ordered to pursue the prince.

source_sentence: 及於深山，隨侍數年。
translation: They went deep into the mountains and waited on him for several years.

source_sentence: 太子不與語，自行如故，陟涉山崗，蔓踰深谷。
translation: The prince didn't talk to them, but continued on his own as before, wading up and down mountainsides and traversing deep valleys.

source_sentence: 五人苦之，言：『此狂人耳，何道之有？
translation: The five men were distressed and said, 'This crazy man, what's the point of the Way?'

source_sentence: 行不擇路，奚可隨也？
translation: Why is it impossible to follow a path that is not chosen by the practitioner?

source_sentence: 設委還者，王滅吾家，不如止此。』
translation: If we were to entrust them with the task of returning, the king would annihilate our family; we might as well stop here.'

source_sentence: 五人所止，有好泉水，甘果不乏。
translation: Where the five men stopped, there was a good spring, and there was no lack of sweet fruit.

source_sentence: 「太子自去，踰越名山，經摩竭界。
translation: "The prince left on his own, crossed a famous mountain, and passed through the Maghreb region.

source_sentence: 瓶沙王出田獵，遙見太子，行山澤中。
translation: King Bimbisāra was out hunting in the fields when he saw the prince walking through the mountains and swamps from a distance.

source_sentence: 即與諸耆長大臣，俱追見之。
translation: He and his elders and ministers followed him.

source_sentence: 王曰：『太子生多奇異、形相炳著，當君四天下，為轉輪聖王，四海顒顒，冀神寶至。
translation: The king said, 'The prince was born with many strange features and an outstanding appearance; he would rule the four worlds as a wheel-turning sage king, and the four seas would be full of people hoping for spiritual treasures.

source_sentence: 何棄天位，自放山藪？
translation: Why did he abandon his position in heaven and abandon himself to the mountains and swamps?'

source_sentence: 必有異見。
translation: I'm sure you have different views.

source_sentence: 願聞其志。』
translation: May I hear about their aspirations?'

source_sentence: 太子答曰：『以吾所見，天地人物，出生有死，劇苦有三，老病死痛，不可得離。
translation: The prince answered, 'From what I've seen, people in heaven and earth are born with death, and there are three severe sufferings, namely, old age, illness, death, and pain, from which it's impossible to escape.

source_sentence: 計身為苦器，憂畏無量，若在尊寵，則有憍佚，貪求快意，天下被患，此吾所厭，故欲入山以修其志。』
translation: Suppose I were to consider myself a vessel of suffering, with measureless sorrow and fear, and if I were to be honored and privileged, I'd become anxious and desolate, desiring the pleasures of the world, which would cause trouble.

source_sentence: 諸耆長曰：『夫老病死，自世之常，何獨豫憂，乃棄美號，隱遁潛居，以勞其形，不亦難乎？』
translation: The elders said, 'Old age, illness, and death are commonplace in this world, so why should I be so worried that I would abandon my beautiful name and retire to a secluded home to work on my body?'

source_sentence: 「太子答曰：『如諸君言，不當豫憂。
translation: "The prince answered, 'As you say, you shouldn't worry about it.

source_sentence: 使吾為王，老到病至，若當死時，寧有代我受此厄者不？
translation: If I were king and I were to grow old and become ill, would there be someone who would accept this misfortune on my behalf when I die?'

source_sentence: 如無有代，胡可勿憂！
translation: If there is no substitute, don't worry, Hu Ke!

source_sentence: 天下雖有慈父孝子，愛徹骨髓，至病死時，不得相代；若此偽身，苦至之日，雖居高位，六親在側，如為盲人設燭，何益於無目者乎？
translation: Although there are loving fathers and dutiful sons in the world who love each other to the marrow of their bones but cannot take their place when they are ill and die, what good would it be to set up a candle for the blind, even though they occupy a high position with their six relatives by their side, if this were a hypocritical body that would reach the day of suffering?

source_sentence: 吾觀眾行，一切無常，皆化非真，樂少苦多，身非己有，世間虛無，難得久居。
translation: As we viewers practice, all things are impermanent, all transformations are not real, there's little pleasure and much suffering, the body doesn't belong to us, and the world is empty, so it's difficult to live in it for a long time.

source_sentence: 物生有死，事成有敗，安則有危，得則有亡，萬物紛擾，皆當歸空。
translation: Things are born and die, things are accomplished and fail, peace is endangered, gain is loss, and all things that are disturbed should return to emptiness.

source_sentence: 精神無形，躁濁不明，行致死生之厄，非直一受而已。
translation: The spirit is immaterial, agitated and unclear, and its actions cause the trouble of death and birth, not just a single sensation.

source_sentence: 但為貪欲，蔽在癡網，沒生死河，莫之能覺。
translation: However, because of desire, they're shielded by the net of delusion and are submerged in the river of birth and death, which no one can understand.

source_sentence: 故吾欲一心思四空淨，度色滅恚，斷求念空，無所適莫，是將反其源，而歸其本，始出其根，如我願得，乃可大安。』
translation: Therefore, I want to single-mindedly contemplate the purity of the four kinds of emptiness, liberate form and cessation of anger, and stop seeking mindfulness of emptiness; there's nothing to be done, so I'll go back to its source and return to its root to get out of it.

source_sentence: 「瓶沙王憙曰：『善哉！
translation: "The Vibhāṣā king said, 'Good!

source_sentence: 菩薩志妙，世間難有，必得佛道，願先度我。』
translation: The bodhisattva's aspiration is marvelous, difficult to find in the world, and he will surely attain the Buddha Way; may he first save me.'

source_sentence: 大子默然而逝。
translation: The Mahākauṣṭhila passed away in silence.

source_sentence: 當度尼連禪河，天神為止流令中暫乾。
translation: He was about to cross the Nairañjanā River when the gods stopped the flow and caused it to dry up for a while.

source_sentence: 大子渡河，行數十里，見三梵志，各與弟子，索居谿邊。
translation: After crossing the river, Dazi traveled several dozen miles and saw three priests, each with a disciple, staying at the edge of a dispute.

source_sentence: 過問其道，自稱言：『吾事梵天，奉於日月，日修火祠，唯水是淨。』
translation: They asked about their path and professed, 'I serve the Brahmā gods, serve the sun and moon, and cultivate fire temples every day; only water is pure.'

source_sentence: 菩薩答曰：『是故生死道耳！
translation: The bodhisattva replied, 'So this is the path of birth-and-death!'

source_sentence: 水不常滿，火不久熱，日出則移，月滿則虧，道在清虛，水焉能令人心淨？』
translation: Water is not always full, fire is not hot for long, the sun rises and moves away, the moon is full and falls short, and the way is clear and empty; how can water purify the mind?'

source_sentence: 傷之而去，行起慈心，遍念眾生老耄專愚，不免疾病，死喪之痛，欲令解脫以一其意，而起悲心。
translation: He takes pity on them and departs, acting with compassion, always mindful that sentient beings are elderly, old, and stupid, and are not immune to the pain of illness and death, wanting to bring about their liberation with a single intention, and generating compassion.

source_sentence: 愍傷一切，皆有飢渴寒暑、得失罪咎艱難之患，欲令安隱以一其意，而起喜心。
translation: He pities all beings who suffer from hunger, thirst, cold, heat, gain, loss, blame, and hardship, and wants to bring peace and stability to their minds, so he gives rise to joy.

source_sentence: 念諸世間，皆有憂苦恐怖遭逢之患，欲令恬惔以一其意，而起護心。
translation: Mindful that all the world is beset by grief and suffering, pain and terror, and encounters, they want to make themselves comfortable and unified in their intentions, and they give rise to a mind of protection.

source_sentence: 欲度五道八難之生，愚蔽曚闇，不見正道，念欲成濟，使得無為，以一其意，得善不喜、逢惡不憂，捨世八事，利衰毀譽稱譏苦樂，不以傾動。
translation: They want to save sentient beings in the five destinies and eight difficulties, who are blinded by ignorance and don't see the right path, and they want to achieve relief and make it possible to be inactive, so they unite their minds, aren't delighted when they attain goodness, aren't sad when they encounter evil, and abandon the eight worldly affairs, profit and loss, disgrace and praise, and criticize suffering and happiness without being tilted by them.

source_sentence: 「既歷深山，到幽閑處，見貝多樹，四望清淨。
translation: "After traveling deep into the mountains, he goes to a secluded place, sees a lot of shellfish and trees, and looks around at the purity of the landscape.

source_sentence: 自念：『我已棄家，在此山澤，不宜復飾髮如凡人意。
translation: He thought to himself, 'Now that I've abandoned my family and am here in the mountains and swamps, it would be inappropriate to decorate my hair as ordinary people would like.'

source_sentence: 以有櫛梳湯沐之念，則失淨戒、正定、慧、解、度知見意，非道之純、污清淨行。
translation: If I think about combing and bathing my hair, I'll lose my purified precepts, right concentration, wisdom, understanding, and knowledge and insight, which are not the purest or most defiled purifying practices of the path.

source_sentence: 當作沙門如菩薩法。』
translation: You must become an ascetic according to the bodhisattva's principles.'

source_sentence: 天神奉剃刀，鬚髮自墮，天受而去。
translation: The gods presented him with a razor, and his beard and hair fell off by themselves; the gods accepted it and departed.

source_sentence: 菩薩即拾槀草，以用布地，正基坐，叉手閉目，一心誓言：『使吾於此肌骨枯腐，不得佛，終不起。』
translation: The bodhisattva then gathered up some dried-up grass, spread it on the ground, sat correctly on his foundation, folded his arms, closed his eyes, and vowed with one mind, 'If my bones wither here, I won't attain Buddhahood and never arise.'

source_sentence: 天神進食，一不肯受。
translation: The gods offered him food, but he refused to accept any of it.

source_sentence: 天令左右，自生麻米，日食一麻一米，以續精氣。
translation: The gods ordered him to produce his own hemp and rice, and he ate one hemp and one rice a day to keep his vitality up.

source_sentence: 端坐六年，形體羸瘦，皮骨相連，玄清靖漠，寂默一心。
translation: After six years of sitting still, his body was emaciated, his skin and bones were connected, he was mysteriously clear and calm, and he was silent and single-minded.

source_sentence: 內思安般，一數、二隨、三止、四觀、五還、六淨，遊志三四，出十二門，無分散意。
translation: He reflects on internal peace, counting one, following two, calming three, observing four, returning five, and purifying six, travels three and four, and goes out twelve ways without distracting his mind.

source_sentence: 神通微妙，棄欲惡法，無復五蓋，不受五欲。
translation: With subtle psychic abilities, he abandons desire for bad things, stops the five hindrances, and doesn't experience the five desires.

source_sentence: 眾惡自滅，念計分明，思想無為，譬如健人得勝怨家，意以清淨，成一禪行。
translation: The numerous evils cease on their own, mindfulness is clearly delineated, and thoughts are unproductive, like a strong man who has overcome a rival and purified his mind with the practice of one meditation.

source_sentence: 心自開解，却情欲意，無惡可改，不復計視，念思已滅。
translation: His mind is naturally liberated, his emotions and desires are abandoned, there's no evil to be changed, he stops imagining, and his mindfulness and thought have ceased.

source_sentence: 譬如山頂之泉，水自中出，盈流於外，谿谷雨潦，無緣得入。
translation: It's like a spring on the top of a mountain, from which water flows in and out, and rain and flooding in a valley have no object to enter.

source_sentence: 恬惔守一，欣然不移，成二禪行。
translation: He's serene, abides cheerfully by oneness, and happily doesn't budge from the practice of the second meditation.

source_sentence: 又棄喜意，唯見無婬，外諸好惡，一不得入，內亦不起，心正身安，譬如蓮華根在水中，華合未開，根莖枝葉，潤漬水中，以淨見真，成三禪行。
translation: Renouncing joy and mindfulness, seeing only the absence of lust, none of the external good and evil can enter, and none of the internal doesn't arise, so his mind and body are at peace, like the lotus with its roots in the water and its flowers still united, but its roots, stems, and leaves wet the water with purity and see the truth, which accomplishes the practice of the third meditation.

source_sentence: 棄苦樂意，無憂喜想，心不依善，亦不附惡，正在其中；如人沐浴潔淨，覆以鮮好白[疊*毛]，中外俱淨，表裏無垢，喘息自滅，寂然無變，成四禪行。
translation: Abandoning suffering and pleasure, without thoughts of sadness and joy, his mind doesn't rely on goodness or attach to evil, and he's right there; like a person who's clean and washed and covered with fresh, fine white [hair], both inside and out are pure, appearances and insides are undefiled, and his respiration ceases on its own, which is tranquil and unchanging, he completes the practice of the fourth meditation.

source_sentence: 譬如陶家和埴調柔，中無沙礫，在作何器，精進開發，無所不能，以得定意；不捨大悲，智慧方便，究暢要妙，通三十七道品之行——所謂四意止、四意斷、四神足念、五根、五力、七覺、八道——周而復始，無復瑕穢，意在三向：一惟向空，念滅不散，無操無捨；二向無想，心定不起，好惡不思。
translation: Like a potter who's gentle and hollow, has no sand or debris in his midst, what kind of vessel is he making, develops his efforts, and is incapable of doing anything in order to attain a concentrated mind; he doesn't abandon great compassion, has wisdom and skillful means, investigates the essentials, and penetrates the thirty-seven factors of the path-what's called the four mental states of cessation, the four mental states of elimination, the four tranquility states of mindfulness, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven awarenesses, and the eight destinies-and goes from week to week without blemish, with his mind in three directions: first, he aims for emptiness, where thoughts cease and don't disperse and there's no manipulation or abandonment; second, he aims for no thoughts, where his mind is concentrated and doesn't arise and he doesn't think about good and evil.

source_sentence: 三向不願，不樂三界，不復生苦。
translation: Third, they're directed toward noncontrivance, not enjoying the three realms, and not again giving rise to suffering.

source_sentence: 便得三活：一離貪欲，二離瞋恚，三離愚癡，無復罣礙。
translation: They then attain three kinds of liveliness: first, freedom from desire, second, freedom from anger, and third, freedom from foolishness, which is no longer an obstruction.

source_sentence: 「於是第六化應聲天，天上魔王，見菩薩清淨無欲，精思不懈，心中煩毒，飲食不甘，伎樂不御，念：『是道成，必大勝我。
translation: "Then, in the sixth transformation heaven, the Māra King in heaven sees the bodhisattva's purity and lack of desire, his concentration and contemplation don't relent, his mind is poisonous, his food and drink aren't pleasant, and his music isn't subdued, and he thinks, 'When this path is accomplished, I'll be greatly surpassed.

source_sentence: 欲及其未作佛，當壞其道意。』
translation: If he wants to become a buddha before he does, he'll destroy his intention to follow the path.'

source_sentence: 魔子薩陀，前諫父曰：『菩薩行淨，三界無比，以得自然神通，眾梵諸天億百，皆往禮侍，此非天王所當沮壞，無為興惡自虧福也。』
translation: Saddharma, the son of Māra, remonstrated with his father, saying, 'A bodhisattva's practice is pure, unequalled in the three realms, and he has attained natural superknowledge that's venerated by hundreds of gods of Brahmā and purity.

source_sentence: 魔王不聽，召三玉女：一名欲妃，二名悅彼，三名快觀，使行壞菩薩意。
translation: When the king of Māra didn't listen, he summoned three jade maidens: one to be his mistress of desire, two to delight him, and three to observe him quickly and cause him to act contrary to the bodhisattva's wishes.

source_sentence: 三女皆被羅縠之衣，服天名香瓔珞珠寶，極為妖冶巧媚之辭，欲亂其意。
translation: Each of the three women was dressed in a monk's robe of silk, wearing jewels and jewelry of divine fame, and spoke in extremely seductive and coquettish terms, intending to disrupt their intentions.

source_sentence: 菩薩心淨，如琉璃珠，不可得污。
translation: The bodhisattva's mind is pure, like a beryl pearl, and cannot be defiled.'

source_sentence: 三女復白曰：『仁德至重，諸天所敬，應有供養故天獻我。
translation: The three women then said, 'The virtues of these three women are so great that they're respected by the gods, and the gods have offered me offerings because I deserve them.

source_sentence: 我等好潔，年在盛時，天女端正，莫有殊我者，願得晨起夜寐供侍左右。』
translation: We're good and pure, and when we're in the prime of life, there's no goddess who's more correct than I. May I rise in the morning and sleep at night to serve at your side?'

source_sentence: 「菩薩答曰：『汝宿有福，受得天身，不惟無常，而作妖媚，形體雖好，而心不端。
translation: "The bodhisattva answered, 'You were blessed in the past to receive the body of a god, but not only are you impermanent and coquettish, but your body is beautiful but your mind is not upright.

source_sentence: 譬如畫瓶中盛臭毒，將以自壞。
translation: It's like a picture vase filled with foul-smelling poison that will destroy itself.

source_sentence: 有何等奇，福難久居，婬惡不善，自亡其本。
translation: What kind of wonder is there? It's difficult to maintain good fortune for a long time, and lust, evil, and unwholesomeness will destroy their roots.

source_sentence: 死即當墮三惡道中，受鳥獸形，欲脫致難。
translation: Immediately after death, they'll fall into the three evil destinies, be shaped like birds and animals, and have difficulty escaping.

source_sentence: 汝輩亂人正意，非清淨種，革囊盛屎而來，何為？
translation: You people have disturbed people's right thoughts, and you're not the pure type who come here with a leather bag full of excrement.

source_sentence: 去！
translation: Go!

source_sentence: 吾不用汝。』
translation: I don't need you.'

source_sentence: 其三玉女，化成老母，不能自復。
translation: The three jade maidens were transformed into old mothers who couldn't get back on their own.

source_sentence: 魔王益忿，更召諸鬼神，合得一億八千萬眾，皆使變為師子熊羆、虎兕象龍牛馬、犬豕猴猨之形，不可稱言。
translation: The demon king became angry and summoned more demons and spirits, combining them into a hundred million, eighty million beings, all of whom were transformed into indescribable forms like lions, bears, tigers, bull elephants, dragons, cattle, horses, dogs, boars, monkeys, and assorted animals.

source_sentence: 虫頭人體，蚖蛇之身，黿龜之首而六目，或一頸而多頭，齒牙爪距，擔山吐火，雷電四繞，擭持戈矛。
translation: They are insect-headed bodies, newt bodies, tortoises with heads and six eyes, or single-necked bodies with many heads, teeth, claws, distances, mountains of fire, thunder and lightning, and gorillas and spears in their traps.

source_sentence: 菩薩慈心，不驚不怖，一毛不動，光顏益好。
translation: With a compassionate heart, the bodhisattva isn't frightened or terrified, not a hair moves, and his radiant face gets better.

source_sentence: 鬼兵退散，不能得近。
translation: The demon army retreated and couldn't get close to him.

source_sentence: 魔王自前，與佛相難詰，其辭曰：「『比丘何求坐樹下，　　樂於林藪毒獸間；　　雲起可畏窈冥冥，　　天魔圍繞不以驚？』
translation: The demon king himself approached the Buddha and had a difficult conversation with him, saying, 'Why would a monk want to sit under a tree, enjoying the woods and the poisonous animals, or be surrounded by clouds that are so fearfully deep and dark that a demon from heaven wouldn't be frightened?'

source_sentence: 「『古有真道佛所行，　　恬惔為上除不明；　　其城最勝法滿藏，　　吾求斯座決魔王。』
translation: "'Once upon a time there was a true path practiced by a Buddha, where serenity was superior and uncertainty removed; his city was the most excellent storehouse of teachings, and I, the king of Māra, was confronted from my seat.'

source_sentence: 「『汝當作王轉金輪，　　七寶自至典四方；　　所受五欲最無比，　　斯處無道起入宮。』
translation: "'You will be the king who turns the golden wheel, and the seven treasures will reach the four directions; the five desires you receive are most incomparable, and there's no place like this where the Way rises and enters the palace.'

source_sentence: 「『吾觀欲盛吞火銅，　　棄國如唾無所貪；　　得王亦有老死憂，　　去此無利勿妄談。
translation: " 'I've observed a desire so great it swallows fiery copper, and I've abandoned my country like spit; gaining the king's hand also brings the sorrow of old age and death; leaving here is no benefit; don't talk about it falsely.'

source_sentence: 「『何安坐林而大語，　　委國財位守空閑；　　不見我興四部兵，　　象馬步兵億八千。
translation: " 'Why does he sit in the forest and talk loudly, entrusting the country's wealth and position to remain idle?' 'Don't you see me raising four armies, with 108,000 elephants, horses, and foot soldiers?

source_sentence: 已見猴猨師子面，　　虎兕毒蛇豕鬼形；　　皆持刀劒擭戈矛，　　超踔哮吼滿空中。』
translation: They've seen the faces of monkeys and assorted assassins, the forms of tigers, bullseye, vipers, snakes, and wild boars and ghosts, all armed with swords, pikes, spears, and spears, and they roar and shout into the air.'

source_sentence: 「『設復億姟神武備，　　為魔如汝來會此；　　矢刃火攻如風雨，　　不先得佛終不起。
translation: "'Suppose there are a billion armies of gods, and Māra like you comes to this meeting, and they attack with arrows and blades like a windstorm, never rising until they first obtain the Buddha.

source_sentence: 魔有本願令我退，　　吾亦自誓不虛還；　　今汝福地何如佛，　　於是可知誰得勝！』
translation: The demons have originally vowed to make me retreat, but I've also vowed not to return in vain; now, how could your stage of merit be like the Buddha's, so you can see who's winning!'

source_sentence: 「『吾曾終身快布施，　　故典六天為魔王；　　比丘知我宿福行，　　自稱無量誰為證？』
translation: "'I once gave quickly and wholeheartedly to charity, so I became the king of Māra in the six heavens. Who are the monks who know my long-standing meritorious actions and claim to be the witness of immeasurability?'

source_sentence: 「『吾昔行願從定光，　　受別為佛釋迦文；　　怒畏想盡故坐斯，　　意定必解壞汝軍。
translation: "'In the past, I practiced vowing to follow the path of Vajra, accepting the special Buddha Śākyamuni; I sat here because my thoughts of anger and fear had ended, and my mind was determined to destroy your armies.

source_sentence: 我所奉事諸佛多，　　財寶衣食常施人；　　仁戒積德厚於地，　　是以脫想無患難。』
translation: I served many buddhas, always gave people food and possessions, accumulated virtue in kindness and morality, and accumulated the ground, so I had no trouble escaping from perception.'

source_sentence: 「菩薩即以智慧力，　　伸手案地是知我；　應時普地砰大動，　　魔與官屬顛倒墮。
translation: ''By the power of wisdom, the bodhisattva then stretches out his hand and puts it on the ground to know that this is me; at that moment, the whole ground stirs up in a great commotion, and Māra and his officials fall into delusion.

source_sentence: 魔王敗績悵失利，　　惛迷却踞前畫地；　其子又曉心乃悟，　　即時自歸前悔過：「『吾以不復用兵器，　　等行慈心却魔怨；　　世用兵器動人心，　　而我以等汝眾生。
translation: The demon king took responsibility for his defeat and loss, and he drew the ground in front of him in delusion. His son then realized it in his mind and immediately returned to himself and repented, "I'll stop using weapons and act with equal compassion to counter the demon's enmity; the world uses weapons to stir up people's minds, but I'll wait for you sentient beings.

source_sentence: 若調象馬雖已調，　　然後故態會復生；　　若得最調如佛性，　　已如佛調無不仁。』
translation: Even though the elephant and horse have been trained, then the old attitude will arise again; if I attain supreme training like the Buddha's nature, I'll be trained like the Buddha with no unkindness.'

source_sentence: 「姟天見佛擒魔眾，　　忍調無想怨自降；　諸天歡喜奉華臻，　　非法王壞法王勝。
translation: 'When the lavatory gods see the Buddha taming the host of Māra, they patiently tame thoughtlessness and subdue resentments on their own; the gods rejoice and give their compliments, for the non-Buddhist king has destroyed the Dharma king and prevailed.

source_sentence: 本從等意智慧力，　　慧能即時攘不祥；　能使怨家為弟子，　　當禮四等道之證。
translation: Based on the power of equanimous wisdom, Huineng immediately dispels ominousness; he makes disciples of those who resent him and will pay homage to the realization of the fourfold path.

source_sentence: 面如滿月色從容，　　名聞十方德如山；　求佛像貌難得比，　　當稽首斯度世仙。
translation: With a face as full as the moon and a calm countenance, his reputation is known in ten directions as a mountain of virtue; seeking the Buddha's likeness is hard to match, so he must bow his head to this sage who has saved the world.

source_sentence: 佛說太子瑞應本起經卷上
translation: Foshuo taizi ruiying benqi jing shou shou
